comments:
Deleting a project
Ran the test suite
(not sure exactly when the trace was logged)

Does a file still have a location when it has been removed?

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at

(LaunchConfiguration.java:99)

(LaunchConfiguration.java:120)

Looking at the API of IResource#getLocation, it is possible to return null. 
Also, when creating a working copy, the super constructor is called with a null 
location, which would cause the same problem - i.e. setRawName
(getLastLocationSegment()) is going to fail.

Fixed in LaunchManagerVisitor.visit().
When creating LaunchConfiguration for passing to 
ILaunchConfigurationListeners, 
instead of calling getLocation() on the IFile, call 
getLocation() on the workspace root and concatenate this to the result of calling getFullPath() 
on the IFile.  The problem was that getLocation() on an IFile may return null if it's project 
doesn't exist.
Fix is verifed but can be made more efficient making use of IPath.append(IPath).
